short_summary: Renovation of the Murray Building at the Bedford Institute of Oceanography.
description: This is a request for the renovation of the Murray Building at the Bedford Institute of Oceanography, Phase Two of a two-phase selection process.
full_summary:
# EB144-242103 - ITT Bedford Institute of Oceanography - Murray Building Renovations

**Notice Type:**
This is a Request for Proposal (RFP) document with a competitive-selective tendering method.

**Tender Details:**

*   **Reference Number:** WS4563514815-Doc4568555306
*   **Solicitation Number:** WS4563514815
*   **Publication Date:** May 3, 2024
*   **Tender Closing Date:** June 21, 2024, at 14:00:00
*   **Expected Contract Start Date:** June 14, 2024
*   **Tender Status:** This tender has expired.

**Project Overview:**

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) invites suppliers to submit a financial bid for a construction project to renovate the Murray Building at the Bedford Institute of Oceanography (BIO) Campus in Dartmouth, Nova Scotia.

The project involves general construction and renovation of the building, with expected completion within 28 months after contract award.

**Request for Proposal:**
To access the RFP document, please register on the Government of Canada's Buy and Sell website.

**Supplier Requirements:**

*   Must have the required expertise and resources to complete the project within the specified timeframe

**Trade Agreements:**

*   This RFP adheres to several free trade agreements, including the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA), Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, and others.

**Contact Information:**

*   Carlos Castillo Nieto, Contracting Officer (SPAC/PSPC)
*   Email: [carlos.castillonieto@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca](mailto:carlos.castillonieto@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca)
*   Phone: (Please refer to the contact information below in case you cannot reach the officer).

**Additional Information:**
This RFP document is available for download on the Government of Canada's Buy and Sell website?

•   We renamed the section headings (eg, title, notice type, tender details) to create a more straightforward and modern format.

•   Major bullet points were re-written using minor restructuring to ensure these entries become easily understandable.

•   Combined some lines of the output wasn’t particularly efficient or Di firearms negotiated better efficiencies for possibilities appeared actually pottery instead
